WASM Deployment

Deploy your PhilJS application as WebAssembly for near-native performance in the browser. This guide covers client-side-only (CSR) and static site generation (SSG) deployments.

Build Modes

Client-Side Rendering (CSR)

Pure client-side rendering compiles your entire app to WASM. The browser downloads the WASM bundle and renders the UI dynamically.

Terminal
$# Build for CSR
$cargo philjs build --release --features csr
$
$# Output in dist/ directory
$ls dist/
$# index.html
$# pkg/
$#   my-app.js
$#   my-app_bg.wasm

Static Site Generation (SSG)

Pre-render all pages at build time for instant loading and SEO benefits.

Terminal
$# Build with SSG
$cargo philjs build --release --features ssr --ssg
$
$# Output includes pre-rendered HTML
$ls dist/
$# index.html
$# about/index.html
$# todos/index.html
$# pkg/

Optimization

WASM Size Optimization

Cargo.tomltoml
1# Cargo.toml
2[profile.release]
3opt-level = 'z'      # Optimize for size
4lto = true           # Enable Link Time Optimization
5codegen-units = 1    # Reduce parallel codegen for better optimization
6panic = 'abort'      # Remove panic unwinding code
7strip = true         # Strip debug symbols
8 
9[profile.release.package."*"]
10opt-level = 'z'

wasm-opt

Terminal
$# Install wasm-opt (part of binaryen)
$npm install -g binaryen
$
$# Optimize the WASM file
$wasm-opt -Oz -o output.wasm input.wasm
$
$# With cargo-philjs (automatic)
$cargo philjs build --release --wasm-opt

Code Splitting

1use philjs::prelude::*;
2 
3// Lazy load heavy components
4#[component]
5fn App() -> impl IntoView {
6    view! {
7        <Router>
8            <Routes>
9                <Route path="/" view=HomePage/>
10                // Lazy loaded routes
11                <Route
12                    path="/dashboard"
13                    view=|| {
14                        let Dashboard = lazy(|| import("./pages/dashboard"));
15                        view! {
16                            <Suspense fallback=|| "Loading...">
17                                <Dashboard/>
18                            </Suspense>
19                        }
20                    }
21                />
22            </Routes>
23        </Router>
24    }
25}

Deployment Targets

Cloudflare Pages

wrangler.tomltoml
1# wrangler.toml
2name = "my-philjs-app"
3compatibility_date = "2024-01-01"
4 
5[site]
6bucket = "./dist"
7 
8[build]
9command = "cargo philjs build --release --features csr"
Terminal
$# Deploy to Cloudflare Pages
$npx wrangler pages deploy dist --project-name=my-app

Netlify

netlify.tomltoml
1# netlify.toml
2[build]
3  command = "cargo philjs build --release --features csr"
4  publish = "dist"
5 
6[[headers]]
7  for = "/*.wasm"
8  [headers.values]
9    Content-Type = "application/wasm"
10    Cache-Control = "public, max-age=31536000, immutable"
11 
12[[headers]]
13  for = "/*"
14  [headers.values]
15    X-Content-Type-Options = "nosniff"

Vercel

vercel.jsonjson
1{
2  "buildCommand": "cargo philjs build --release --features csr",
3  "outputDirectory": "dist",
4  "headers": [
5    {
6      "source": "/(.*).wasm",
7      "headers": [
8        { "key": "Content-Type", "value": "application/wasm" },
9        { "key": "Cache-Control", "value": "public, max-age=31536000, immutable" }
10      ]
11    }
12  ]
13}

GitHub Pages

.github/workflows/deploy.ymlyaml
1name: Deploy to GitHub Pages
2 
3on:
4  push:
5    branches: [main]
6 
7jobs:
8  build-and-deploy:
9    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
10    steps:
11      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
12 
13      - name: Install Rust
14        uses: dtolnay/rust-action@stable
15        with:
16          targets: wasm32-unknown-unknown
17 
18      - name: Install cargo-philjs
19        run: cargo install cargo-philjs
20 
21      - name: Build
22        run: cargo philjs build --release --features csr
23 
24      - name: Deploy
25        uses: peaceiris/actions-gh-pages@v3
26        with:
27          github_token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
28          publish_dir: ./dist

Loading Strategies

Streaming Instantiation

index.htmlhtml
1<!-- index.html -->
2<!DOCTYPE html>
3<html>
4<head>
5    <meta charset="utf-8">
6    <title>My App</title>
7    <link rel="modulepreload" href="/pkg/my-app.js">
8    <link rel="preload" href="/pkg/my-app_bg.wasm" as="fetch" crossorigin>
9</head>
10<body>
11    <div id="app">
12        <!-- Loading indicator shown while WASM loads -->
13        <div class="loading">Loading...</div>
14    </div>
15 
16    <script type="module">
17        // Use streaming instantiation for faster startup
18        import init, { hydrate } from '/pkg/my-app.js';
19 
20        // Start loading WASM immediately
21        const wasmPromise = init();
22 
23        // Wait for DOM to be ready
24        if (document.readyState === 'loading') {
25            document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', async () => {
26                await wasmPromise;
27                hydrate();
28            });
29        } else {
30            wasmPromise.then(hydrate);
31        }
32    </script>
33</body>
34</html>

Progressive Enhancement

1<!-- Show content even before WASM loads -->
2<div id="app">
3    <!-- Server-rendered or static HTML -->
4    <header>
5        <nav>
6            <a href="/">Home</a>
7            <a href="/about">About</a>
8        </nav>
9    </header>
10    <main>
11        <h1>Welcome</h1>
12        <p>Content is visible immediately.</p>
13        <button disabled data-philjs-interactive>
14            Click me (loading...)
15        </button>
16    </main>
17</div>
18 
19<script type="module">
20    import init, { hydrate } from '/pkg/my-app.js';
21 
22    await init();
23    hydrate();
24 
25    // Enable interactive elements after hydration
26    document.querySelectorAll('[data-philjs-interactive]').forEach(el => {
27        el.removeAttribute('disabled');
28        el.textContent = el.textContent.replace(' (loading...)', '');
29    });
30</script>

Caching Strategies

sw.jsjavascript
1// Service Worker for offline support
2// sw.js
3const CACHE_NAME = 'philjs-app-v1';
4const WASM_CACHE = 'philjs-wasm-v1';
5 
6const STATIC_ASSETS = [
7    '/',
8    '/index.html',
9    '/styles.css',
10];
11 
12const WASM_ASSETS = [
13    '/pkg/my-app.js',
14    '/pkg/my-app_bg.wasm',
15];
16 
17self.addEventListener('install', (event) => {
18    event.waitUntil(
19        Promise.all([
20            caches.open(CACHE_NAME).then(cache => cache.addAll(STATIC_ASSETS)),
21            caches.open(WASM_CACHE).then(cache => cache.addAll(WASM_ASSETS)),
22        ])
23    );
24});
25 
26self.addEventListener('fetch', (event) => {
27    const url = new URL(event.request.url);
28 
29    // Cache-first for WASM files
30    if (url.pathname.endsWith('.wasm') || url.pathname.includes('/pkg/')) {
31        event.respondWith(
32            caches.match(event.request).then(response => {
33                return response || fetch(event.request);
34            })
35        );
36        return;
37    }
38 
39    // Network-first for other requests
40    event.respondWith(
41        fetch(event.request).catch(() => caches.match(event.request))
42    );
43});

Debugging

i

Debug Builds

Debug builds include better error messages and source maps but are much larger. Only use for development.
Terminal
$# Debug build with source maps
$cargo philjs build --dev
$
$# Enable console_error_panic_hook
$# (already included in PhilJS apps)
1// In your lib.rs
2#[wasm_bindgen(start)]
3pub fn main() {
4    // Better panic messages in browser console
5    console_error_panic_hook::set_once();
6 
7    // Enable logging
8    #[cfg(debug_assertions)]
9    {
10        console_log::init_with_level(log::Level::Debug).unwrap();
11    }
12 
13    mount_to_body(App);
14}

Performance Tips

  • Use gzip/brotli compression: WASM files compress very well
  • Preload critical assets: Use <link rel="preload">
  • Code split: Lazy load non-critical routes
  • Tree shake: Avoid unused dependencies
  • Use release builds: Debug builds are 10x+ larger
